body:
I agree that at least for a not null column as boolean (tinyint 1) the empty string must default to false instead of null here.
As @markstory once said:

> False is '' in string form.

And the null conversation would just create a DB error here.

> ..at least for a not null column...

The database type classes have no info about the table schema, hence marshalling values based whether column is nullable or not is not possible.

That may very well be the case, here then the discussed issue of auto-transforming null to false of the closed issues and my workaround of Nullable behavior applies.
For boolean true/false(1/0): Null just doesn't make sense as marshaled input coming from empty string (`''`), or at least not as final data reaching the database. Intuitively, this should set the column to `false` = `0` here for DB.

> For boolean true/false(1/0): Null just doesn't make sense as marshaled input coming from empty string ('')

Marshalling empty string to `null` would make sense if the column was nullable. One can have nullable boolean columns. So we need to think of a solution which works for both nullable and non-nullable columns.

One way to deal with this is make the FormHelper convert `false` to `0` for boolean fields. Making `ContextInterface::val()` do that could be considered, since context classes do have the schema info.

That sounds like a fair compromise.
I think we had similar issues also in some other place before, where a `false` => `''` => null aka nothing then would result in an undesired value in the end.

If we scope this to booleans, this should be without side effects then.

issue.title: hidden boolean field does not vaidate

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
This is a (multiple allowed):

* [x] bug
* [ ] enhancement
* [ ] feature-discussion (RFC)

* CakePHP Version: 4.1.1
* Platform and Target: Debian Buster and others

### What you did
I have a form in with a hidden boolean field which value is false.
With #14548 a value of false is stored (correctly) as '0', but for the SecurityComponent FormHelper#hidden returns the value as
  (string)$option['val']
see FormHelper line 1635
So the SsecurityComponent expects the value to be an empty string "", but in POST it is "0", which causes validatePost to fail

### What happened
See above, POST data fails to validate

### What you expected to happen
POST validates, of course :)
My guess is that the security is called before BasicWidget had a change to change $option
